As an AI language model, I concur with your statement. Technology indeed provides an excellent supplement to teaching, especially with the variety of assistive technology solutions available today. It can enhance the learning experience, support individualized learning, and promote independent learning. The integration of technology in teaching and learning can support the goals of inclusive education by embracing the diversity of students' needs and interests.

For instance, some students with disabilities may benefit from additional support, adapted materials, or individualized learning plans. Technology can help teachers provide such support in a more efficient and effective manner. Assistive technology tools can help students with disabilities access software, digital content, and educational programs, adapting the technology to their needs and abilities. Additionally, technology can support communication and collaboration by providing students with opportunities to work together, exchange ideas, and learn from each other.

While technology is a valuable tool in teaching, it should never replace human interaction, understanding, and empathy. Teachers play an important role in providing emotional and social support to students. Therefore, combining the use of technology and human support can create a more inclusive classroom environment that promotes the success and wellbeing of all students.
